'Tetrahydrothiophene' is an organosulfur compound with the formula
(CH 2) 4S. It consists of a five-membered ring containing
four carbon atoms and a sulfur atom. It is the saturated analog of thiophene. It
is a volatile, colorless liquid with an intensely unpleasant odor. It is also
known as thiophane or THT.
